quoteFirst: Clay enjoyed almost alone for years the advantage of winning popularity by this simple means; but in 1810, at least along the Atlantic coast, such appeals had little popular success. quoteLast: . Giles did not vote. Samuel Smith, Leib, and even Crawford were in the majority.
